column2: 4. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?

column2: 6. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column8: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 7. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column6: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column8: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column10: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.

column4: there is a school zone after the curve.

column2: 11. Implied Consent Law means that by driving a motor vehicle you have given your consent to:
column4: keep your vehicle in safe operating condition.
column6: appear in court if arrested for a traffic violation.
column8: avoid implicit hazards while driving.
column10: take a breath, blood, or urine test if arrested for driving under the influence.

column2: 12. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 13. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: be alert and obey all traffic signals.
column6: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column8: look both ways before crossing the tracks.

column2: 14. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column4: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 17. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Honk your horn.

column2: 19. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: You.
